articles.headline: BP Settlements Seen on Safety and Price Cases
articles.snippet: BP is preparing to settle accusations that it was  indifferent to safety and manipulated energy prices.
articles.abstract: BP is preparing to settle accusations that it was  indifferent to safety and manipulated energy prices.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 23 — The British energy company BP, tarnished by a string of costly legal problems, is preparing to settle accusations that it was criminally indifferent to worker safety and that it manipulated energy prices, government officials and lawyers involved in the separate cases said on Tuesday.
articles.byline: By Stephen Labaton and Lowell Bergman

articles.headline: China’s Green Energy Gap
articles.snippet: In China, where coal is king, the government’s push to increase the use of alternative energies faces obstacles, from bureaucracy to bottlenecks in manufacturing.
articles.abstract: In China, where coal is king, the government’s push to increase the use of alternative energies faces obstacles, from bureaucracy to bottlenecks in manufacturing.
articles.lead_paragraph: BOXING, China — By next autumn, a muddy construction site here in a rural part of eastern China will give way to a small power plant that burns corn stalks and cotton stalks to generate electricity for nearby villages and steam for a neighboring industrial complex.

articles.headline: Inquiries at Investor-Owned Nursing Homes
articles.snippet: Congress said it would investigate business practices at nursing homes owned by private investment groups, after staffing at many of the homes was shown to have been cut severely.
articles.abstract: Congress said it would investigate business practices at nursing homes owned by private investment groups, after staffing at many of the homes was shown to have been cut severely.
articles.lead_paragraph: Two Congressional committees announced yesterday that they would investigate business practices at nursing homes owned by private investment groups.

articles.headline: Lessons Even Thomas Could Learn
articles.snippet: Companies involved in the recent toy recalls are not simply the unlucky ones that got caught, but are the ones that didn’t make an effort to keep their toys safe.
articles.abstract: Companies involved in the recent toy recalls are not simply the unlucky ones that got caught, but are the ones that didn’t make an effort to keep their toys safe.
articles.lead_paragraph: Let’s return now to the story of Thomas the Tank Engine and the lead paint.

articles.headline: Victims in Wildfire’s Path Say, ‘Why Me?’
articles.snippet: Fires raged across Southern California, burning some houses to the ground and sparing others.
articles.abstract: Fires raged across Southern California, burning some houses to the ground and sparing others.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN DIEGO, Oct. 23 — Through a dirty fog of ash and soot, a sport utility vehicle dashed up one street and then another, turning around again and again as it met police barricades, fire trucks and finally a wall of glowing billowing smoke.
articles.byline: By Randal C. Archibold and Solomon Moore

articles.headline: In Foray Into TV, Google Is to Track Ad Audiences
articles.snippet: Google plans to announce a partnership with Nielsen to give advertisers a better snapshot of how many people are viewing television commercials on a second-by-second basis.
articles.abstract: Google plans to announce a partnership with Nielsen to give advertisers a better snapshot of how many people are viewing television commercials on a second-by-second basis.
articles.lead_paragraph: Google, which dominates the market for advertising on the Internet, seems to be hoping to do the same thing on television.

articles.headline: Merrill Lynch to Report $2.5 Billion in Added Loss
articles.snippet: Merrill Lynch is expected to report that it will add to its announced write-downs, a person briefed on the plan said.
articles.abstract: Merrill Lynch is expected to report that it will add to its announced write-downs, a person briefed on the plan said.
articles.lead_paragraph: Merrill Lynch is expected to report today that it will add about $2.5 billion more to the $5 billion worth of write-downs it has already announced, according to a person briefed on the situation.
articles.byline: By JENNY ANDERSON and LANDON THOMAS, Jr

articles.headline: California Fires Out of Control as More Than 500,000 Flee
articles.snippet: As fires burned for a third day across Southern California, officials worried they could spread toward more populated areas.
articles.abstract: As fires burned for a third day across Southern California, officials worried they could spread toward more populated areas.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 23 — Punishing winds and unstable thermal conditions — married with strained firefighting resources — stymied efforts Tuesday to contain a slew of wildfires burning for a third day across Southern California.
